page.title: 17WALKING: CHERRY WILLINGHAM
page.content: Cherry Willingham and Reepham are pleasant country villages to walk around. Each has a good system of footpaths and with few exceptions the local farmers do not mind you walking around their fields especially if they are fallow or permanant grassland. From Cherry Willingham it is possible to walk out across the old airfield (which is not in the block) and either to Fiskerton, another village, or to Reepham as an afternoon wander. Another popular walk would be to take Green Lane toward Lincoln and go to Greetwell Hall where there is an old church. From Reepham you can go round the back of the village along the stream or out across the fields towards Sudbrooke.
